channel.title: Cleaning out the client for players
channel.description: In the client I am going to give to my players what is there suppose to be because some things like the compiler should not be there for them, so what EXACTLY is suppose to be in the client for my players?

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

You can create a new acc on the server and change your ip.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“g0dp0wr, post:18, topic:447596”]honestly, if your letting people use your client… id allow the hidden option, just incase a programmer comes a long and finds some fault in your client or mods your client and tells you of some ideas for customs… idk some things like that happen sometimes.

but then again not deleting them gives you a higher risk of someone being able to cheat or hack your client. so its up to you. id just say screw it and hide the files, only bcuz u can always ipmute/ipban a player.[/quote]

Not very often something like that happens though. Most of the time they are there to create havoc.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“g0dp0wr, post:18, topic:447596”]honestly, if your letting people use your client… id allow the hidden option, just incase a programmer comes a long and finds some fault in your client or mods your client and tells you of some ideas for customs… idk some things like that happen sometimes.

but then again not deleting them gives you a higher risk of someone being able to cheat or hack your client. so its up to you. id just say screw it and hide the files, only bcuz u can always ipmute/ipban a player.[/quote]

Or things like a programmer comes around and wants to fuck with retarded owners, like yourself.

Open source
Ability to do (almost) anything

[hr]

Also, banning, muting, etc. are very uneffective. If the ‘hacker’ knows what they’re doing.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @g0dp0wr g0dp0wr
item.description:
@g0dp0wr wrote:

honestly, if your letting people use your client… id allow the hidden option, just incase a programmer comes a long and finds some fault in your client or mods your client and tells you of some ideas for customs… idk some things like that happen sometimes.

but then again not deleting them gives you a higher risk of someone being able to cheat or hack your client. so its up to you. id just say screw it and hide the files, only bcuz u can always ipmute/ipban a player.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Better yet! Load the cache from the server and JAR your client.

I like this.

Never even thought of doing that. Quite frankly, this is probably the smartest thing posted in this thread.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Better yet! Load the cache from the server and JAR your client.

Lol easy answer i can’t believe people didn’t even think of that.

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Just delete the .java files, hide the sprites, and .class files.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

i want fire:

Should I delete anything in the sprites?

If you know that there are unused ones, you may. But if you’re unsure, you should just leave them alone.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @i_want_fire i want fire
item.description:
@i_want_fire wrote:

Should I delete anything in the sprites?

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“heatrn11, post:7, topic:447596”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=550494.msg4034714#msg4034714 date=1341093749]
That or Do ctrl + A, right click properties, check “hidden” box, then apply. This will make all of the files hidden. You can hide all of the files except for the run.bat
[/quote]
They can un-hide the files, by hiding the folder again.[/quote]

And you can decompile class files. Hiding the files and deleting the .java files are the best way of “cleaning” out the client for players.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Delete the .java files, then hide the class files. They only way they could access the .java files *is if they decomplied the client.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

mista pnut:

Like I said, delete all of the .java files. If you want it to be easier, sort them by file type and you can select them all at once easily.

Make sure you have a copy of your client, just incase you want to modify it.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

item.source: Cleaning out the client for players

item.title: Cleaning out the client for players
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

m1lkman:

That or Do ctrl + A, right click properties, check “hidden” box, then apply. This will make all of the files hidden. You can hide all of the files except for the run.bat

They can un-hide the files, by hiding the folder again.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleaning out the client for players
